cyclone.name: ETA
cyclone.current_location: about 65 miles south of Naples, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to drift west-southwest today, stall over the SE Gulf, then turn slowly north and northeast, reaching the Georgia–South Carolina coastal area late Friday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Georgia/South Carolina coast (Savannah–Charleston corridor)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Florida west coast from Englewood to Anna Maria Island and the northwestern Bahamas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Florida coast from Brevard/Volusia County line to Anna Maria Island, the Florida Keys and adjacent waters
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coastline from the Florida Keys northward to coastal South Carolina and Georgia
weather_observation.wind: Low to moderate chance (≤11%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds late Friday; gusts could reach 35–45 mph if the center tracks close to the coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding (<3 ft) possible with persistent on-shore flow and high tide Friday–Saturday.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible late week as outer rain bands sweep across coastal South Carolina.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, rip currents, and isolated tornado threat in rain bands late Thursday into Friday.
